TopicTitle: The KSR Vertikal - (Relatively) Good-looking and easy-to-fly VTOL - Yak-38 replica

Articles.Content:
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Get it here!

The Kerbal's Socialist Republic is proud to present its first contribution to the KSP Forums, the KSR Vertikal. This versatile, easy-to-fly Vertical Take-Off and Landing plane comes equipped with enough fuel to consider it a short- to medium-range vessel, and was roughly inspired by the Yak-38. Although there are a few issues with wobbling while landing due to the small area covered by the landing gears, we can assure you that the engineers who instigated these problems are... Silenced. An overall great flyer, President Ferris urges friendly nations to quickly purchase at least a few of these valuable pieces of machinery before they're all gone. Please, buy one. We basically drained the treasury designing this...

Important Craft Information

Part Count: 42

Action Groups:

1: Toggle VTOL Engine

2: Toggle Horizontal Engines

3: Toggle Ladder

The craft is sometimes twitchy while landing and while on lower throttle with the VTOL engine. The Kerbal's Socialist Republic does not recognize the Kerbonational Court, and therefore is not legally responsible for any Kerbal deaths that occur due to the KSR Vertikal.

Creator's Note

I've been playing this game for roughly a year, and have just very recently gotten into spaceplanes. Actually quite satisfied with this, as it is my first really successful VTOL. Be warned, it uses reaction wheels for stability, so if you don't like the 'cheatiness' that comes with using mainly reaction wheels instead of actual wings for stability, then you probably don't want this craft. Of course, it is also a fantastic glider, so decide for yourself if it is cheaty . Have fun!
